WRITING.TEXT: Hi. I just wanted to say you're not alone, lots of us have this same anxiety and this fight inside our own heads. I recommend that you read Many lives many masters by Brian Weiss, Journey of souls and Destiny of souls by Michael Newton. Also, an interesting book I've started reading is Near death experiences: an evidence for the existence of God and Heaven by J. Steve Miller. I hope this helps :)

WRITING.TITLE: As long as I have my consciousness, I have everything
WRITING.TEXT: I wasn't destined to live a "normal" life. So many hardships happened, that without awakening I wouldn't have survived. But now I see it. My strength and courage comes from my consciousness, they come from me, not the ego me, but the consciousness that emanates from behind my eyes. It's beautiful to realize this because half my life I had the fear that others can hurt me, and I was really scared, deep down, but I realized this.. and boom, fear gone. Cause I know if I don't give them my attention, they can't really take anything of value away from me.

WRITING.TITLE: Spirituality is not about selfishness
WRITING.TEXT: I just realized something. It's not about having the shiniest spiritual ego, knowing more than others or obsessively trying to reach a certain state, it's at its core being a good person, motivated by light and kindness. It's that simple. You don't have to rush to reach enlightement in this life, we have all the time in the world. But what I see on this subreddit about people being cold and arrogant about their spiritual growth is SO not what spirituality is about. Humbleness is so important. So is kindness.
gt;We #8217;re all in this together :) Exactly! There's no competition, only oneness.
Interesting point of view. #128578;
You're welcome. Good luck on your journey!
I try to be good to those that hurt me. Overcoming hate towards those who hurt me was a big part of my journey.
I agree, positive energy is important, and so is communication with the soul.

I've been thinking about this since I posted this post (about forcing kindness). But the truth is, we need to work on ourselves to be kinder and catch ourselves when we aren't being kind. I don't know if that's "forcing it", but I think that's very important. Cause sometimes we get hurt, and can lash out. Isn't it a better world if everyone is kinder, though? We need to think about other's feelings as if they were our own.

gt;Pointing out the faults of ego in others probably is not so spiritual. Understanding where another is trying to point from is fine, but to judge is not a divine act of spirituality either. Thanks for pointing that out. If you meant that about me. Honestly you are right, it is hard to grow spiritually on Earth, and I constantly feel like I'm not seeing the whole picture and forgetting something. The more I learn about spirituality the more I realize two opposite things can be true at the same time. Like "we have all the time in the world" and "it's hard on Earth, we should hurry".

I guess we have to agree to disagree. I know how much hurt others have caused me and I could've lived without that had they just chose to be better people. So I try to be careful with others when I'm in a position when I might cause pain, when someone is being vulnerable.
You have a great day too!
It depends I think. Some are genuinely happy to share, and some have an element of superiority to it. But it's not mine to judge.
Good luck hun! You seem like a knowledgeable person, keep sharing!
Oh, of course. I hope I didn't come off as if I said that it's some exclusive thing.
gt;So in this state we could simply describe with a lot of qualities, not only kindness, but honesty, openess, acceptation, love, empathy Yes, I agree.
I agree!

WRITING.TITLE: Just some thoughts on "energy vampires"
WRITING.TEXT: I see this term get thrown around alot and I'd like to share my view on it. Not everyone that you call an "energy vampire" is aware of what they're doing, or that they take away energy from surrounding people. I think people who are so called energy vampires aren't malicious most of the time (there are cases though when others suck on your energy and are completely aware of it, I'm not talking about those individuals now). They are probably depressed, beaten down and wrecked people who desperately need help. I know because I was once like that and I noticed some people would get uneasy around me and energetically, I would feel a certain rejection. This was years ago. I am asking you not to reject these individuals, but to try to offer them help, because from my experience, not just with myself but with other people too, these people have been sucked dry by life and are now trying to balance their energies by sucking energy from the environment, and unconsciously other people. Don't be so quick to judge them and reject them, because this will further their suffering.
I agree. We are also here to better ourselves, not just the world.
We are all in the wrong somewhere. Nobody is perfect. We're all just learning.
I feel both things. They aren't mutually exclusive. I have compassion for those who are spiritually elitist but also it bugs me so I made this post.
Nicely said.
It's not selfish at all.
I don't like that they refer to people as bots, but I don't have much experience with them to form an opinion.

WRITING.TITLE: 7s and falling in love
WRITING.TEXT: I wanna hear about your experiences with craving love. I'm a sx 7 and a huge romantic. I crave love, especially when I'm not getting much satisfaction in the form of good times and fun. Over the years, I've come to realize my need for so much stimulation is because I equate getting what I want with being loved and I feel satisfied when I get what I want. I actually recently read that sentence in an enneagram book, after I've come to that realization. When life is really slow and boring my emotional cravings can get really strong and even needy. I just wanna hear about other 7s because there isn't much said on this topic in enneagram books.
Oh man, I agree so much.
Yesss! I agree so much, I have thought about this a lot and it horrifies me how the system treats people.

WRITING.TITLE: Is anyone familiar with the seven rays and can explain them to me?
WRITING.TEXT: I tried looking online but I feel every article just provides one piece of the puzzle. I would love, if someone is familiar, to get an in-depth explanation of the 7 rays. How they show themselves in the personality and the soul.
I hope there's a free version, thanks btw!
I have synesthesia too! For me the colours are as follows: 1 white, 2 yellow, 3 green, 4 red, 5 light blue, 6 royal blue, 7 indigo, 8 magenta, 9 pink.
"the endless drudgery of hair washing" made me laugh!
7w8 - liberal

What about surviving, flourishing and showing people that despite what they did to you, you can still be happy and alive? The real revenge is surviving and getting better. I thought I would never get better, but I got better. It's going to be okay, you just need to work for it, but a stranger on the internet (me) believes in you.

Don't trust the universe, trust yourself to get through what the universe throws at you. I've trusted the universe and it has proven not to be trusted. Work on your strenght, I hope you feel better. Sorry if my comment isn't of help, I'm kinda in a similar situation and not thinking very positively. Just remember that things might be hard, but inside yourself you have the power to overcome anything.

WRITING.TITLE: Heavy body feeling?
WRITING.TEXT: A week ago it started. I haven't been able to see a doctor because of corona. But my body feels like it's made of rocks. I'm not yet diagnosed, but I remember reading about dysautonomia before and that might explain it? I don't know. My blood pressure is fine, but I'm getting a fast heartbeat and this horrible heavy body feeling. It's so bad I can't really walk around the house or outside. Do you experience the heavy body feeling? I'm really lost and I wonder what this could be a symptom of. If this is not allowed, I'm sorry.
Thanks for your reply!
Thanks, it really is the worst.
Everyone has a soul. Some people are more experienced so they are "old souls", but there is nothing wrong with being a younger soul, we all grow at our own pace.

It is a form of privilege, honestly. It's beautiful that you have compassion for so much people you don't even know. I applaud you for that, because most people don't really have the same compassion. I don't really have much of an answer to your question other than I understand. I've been there too, questioning the suffering I and other people have to endure. I hope you find your answers.
I don't think it's possible to sell your soul.

WRITING.TITLE: How do you keep your faith in bad times?
WRITING.TEXT: I've been having physical health issues lately and am finding it very hard to maintain a positive attitude, I'm suffering. How can you keep your faith when things are bad?
Sometimes it feels like the only reason is to suffer in life. That's why I lost my faith. I couldn't make sense of what was happening to me in my life.
I hope so. Thanks for the kind words.
I'm so sorry that happened to you, and it's beautiful that you found the divine in it all.
Thanks for this. Btw happy cake day!

WRITING.TITLE: Having qualities of your stress point?
WRITING.TEXT: I'm a sx/so 7, when I found the enneagram I knew I was a 7 instantly, because everything fit perfectly. But I've noticing lately that I have subtle qualities of enneagram 1, my stress point. Like having morals, wanting to change people for the better, being into causes, judging people for being immoral and generally I've always been pure in the sense that I didn't mean any harm to anyone. I think I read something about people having qualities of their stress and growth points. I can't remember where I read that, so I can't really check to see if that's true. What do you think? Do you have characteristics of your stress point? Is this a thing or am I wrong?
Thanks for the article!
I needed this right now. #128149; Thank you.
I relate so hard to your post. I try to look at the bright side but there isn't a bright side to all of this..
Hii!

Yeah, sometimes life can just be shitty. I hate when someone says you can't be a 7 because you see the dark side of things. I learned to see the dark side because my life was nothing but dark for a long time. It's healthy to see things realistically. Denial is not healthy.

Realize that your actual value is always there, you don't need to be competitive or the best at anything. It's enough to just be yourself. Loving yourself is the solution to seeking love outside of yourself. I relate to you because I'm an unhappy broken 7, and we're both types that are suppoused to be happy and cheerful all the time, at least that's the stereotype.
I'm so sorry for your loss. I always wanted to read this book, but I had the idea that it was too complicated, so I'm really glad you made this.
I felt that too for the longest time. Like my days are numbered.

WRITING.TITLE: If we lived in a more accepting, loving and open-minded society the amount of people with depression and anxiety would be much smaller
WRITING.TEXT: I know I'm being unrealistic because it's hard for most people to change, but everyone would be much happier and less insecure if we gave people the benefit of the doubt instead of only caring about ourselves and making insensitive judgments towards other people.
I agree, it isn't completely caused by the society we live in, some of it is pure biology. But it certainly doesn't help that society is the way it is.
It just makes me sad and angry that there is so much people who hurt others and judge them and all that shit. It's really not that hard to be a decent human being.
Same.

No, because love matters. Even if you do a small thing, it may impact someone's life in a big way. If you choose understanding and compassion instead of prejudice, for example, you have an effect on the lives of others, that is inherently positive.
My cat does this too. It's so cute, wish I could know what she's dreaming about.
What a sweetie #128525;

WRITING.TITLE: Initial positive effects of antidepressant gone. Will they come back?
WRITING.TEXT: I felt so great 2 weeks after I started prozac but it only lasted a few days and dissapeared. Now it's been a week since I last felt good and I'm sad because now I don't feel anything. Is this a regular occurence, will the good feelings come back?
Do you think the effect of antidepressants can fluctuate troughout time?
